answer_html: \(\begin{Vmatrix} A\vec{x} \end{Vmatrix} = 3\)3 is not smaller than 2, so this is impossible.
hints_html:
Take norms on both sides and recall that

\(\begin{Vmatrix} A\vec{x} \end{Vmatrix} \leq \begin{Vmatrix} A \end{Vmatrix} \begin{Vmatrix} \vec{x} \end{Vmatrix}\)
question: 1 (c)
sols_html:
Recall that \(\begin{Vmatrix} A\vec{x} \end{Vmatrix} \leqslant \begin{Vmatrix} A \end{Vmatrix}\begin{Vmatrix} \vec{b} \end{Vmatrix} = 2\cdot1 = 2\)

and

\(\begin{Vmatrix} A\vec{x} \end{Vmatrix} = \begin{Vmatrix} 3\\0 \end{Vmatrix} = 3\)

3 is not smaller than 2, so this is impossible.
statement_html: If A is a 2 x 2 matrix with \(\|A\| = 2\), is it possible that \(A\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}\)? Give a reason.
statement_latex:
If \emph{A} is a \emph{2 x 2} matrix with $\|A\| = 2$, is it possible
that
$A\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}$?
Give a reason.
statement_raw: If ''A'' is a ''2 x 2'' matrix with <math>\|A\| = 2</math>, is it possible that <math>A\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 0\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}</math>? Give a reason.
